page.title: 06HOUSEWIFE 4O+ WITH FAMILY
page.content: She has lived in Portchester for twenty three years. She sees her main problem in life as worrying about her children and what the future holds for them. To her, the main national problem is that many people expect to be kept by the State instead of standing on their own two feet. To solve this she would introduce benefit reforms ie cease Child Benefit payments, reduce Supplementary Benefits and create community jobs for the unemployed instead of giving them benefit payments. The main local issues are housing and recreational facilities. She would like to see more retirement homes and better recreational facilities. She hopes for a peaceful world community and more respect from abroad which we have lost in her life time.
